forumNotes.author: tyler.durden
forumNotes.content:
Hi, I need some advise here.  

Trying to boot some 4 and 8Gb USB Flash Drives with a BootCD image.  

No problems on notebooks, but on a desktop pc based on a Gigabyte GA-945GCM-S2L MB, Intel 945, the error is always something with GRLDR missing. When MBR try all the HDs, it does not find a FAT32 partition, and when it try fd0 correctly identity as FAT32 but don't find GRLDR.  

Formatted with NTFS it has no problems, but keep booting as fd0. The bootlace parameter MB --mbr-disable-floppy shouldn't avoid this behaviour?  

The same UFDs were bootable with WinPE when formatted with FAT32 and XP MBR, so seems that GRLDR MBR has some issues with some BIOS (or vice-versa).  

Tried all possible format tools, converting UFD file system, FAT16, 32, cluster sizes, fixed bit, grub4dos versions, etc. Also tried force boot it as USB-ZIP, USB-CDROM, USB-HDD, USB-FDD. I'm missing a 'please UFO's get me out of here' option ![:cheers:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/cheers.gif) .  

Any help would be appreciated! I'm pretty sure that I'm not the only one with this issue.  

Regards!

forumNotes.author: tinybit
forumNotes.content:
You didn't tell which version you were using.   

The latest build is highly recommended, downloadable at [http://grub4dos.nufans.net/](http://grub4dos.nufans.net/ "External link")  

Try to use bootlace.com(also please use the latest one) to install grldr boot record on to the MBR track. See README_GRUB4DOS.txt

forumNotes.author: tyler.durden
forumNotes.content:
Tried all latest versions, but not the command line utility bootlace.com. I've always wrote MBR with grubinst_gui.exe. I'll try and report back here.  
Thanks! :smile:

forumNotes.author: tyler.durden
forumNotes.content:
Now I've used the zip of grub4dos-0.4.4 2008-12-30.  
Since I'm on Windows XP, created the USB drive, made a image file of it and run:  

bootlace.com --floppy image.img  

Was reported sucess, FAT32.  

I've writed the image back on UFD, tested.   

The exact same error:  

Try (hd0,0): NTFS5: No grldr  
Try (hd0,1): Extended:   
Try (hd0,2): Invalid or null  
Try (hd0,3): Invalid or null  
Try (hd0,4): NTFS5: No grldr  

Error: cannot find GRLDR in all devices. Press Ctrl+Alt+Delete to restart.  

After this I even modified byte 5EH directly on MBR (Partition number), same results.  

BIOS is latest, 2008/09/05.  

I can provide any other info. Thanks.

forumNotes.author: tyler.durden
forumNotes.content:
Points to me! :smile:   

Solved using Syslinux, very easy! surely will help others too:  

[http://www.kernel.or...slinux-3.72.zip](http://www.kernel.org/pub/linux/utils/boot/syslinux/syslinux-3.72.zip "External link")  

syslinux.exe -ma \<drive letter\>  

(So seems that GRLDR and its MBR has still room for improvement on compatibility)  

Thanks! :smile:
